frameDefinitions: In this frame, the Patient, an inorganic item, undergoes a chemical process caused by another entity, which renders it less useful, desirable or stable.
An Earner receives Earnings by providing Goods to a Buyer; providing the Goods also generally entails a cost, which may or may not be included in the consideration.
An Agent alters some Material in some useful way by means of some chemical or physical Alterant.
An Agent changes Tools, from the Old_tool to a New_tool.
An Agent or Cause causes an Entity to change, either in its category membership or in terms of the value of an Attribute.
These are words relating to emptying containers and clearing areas of some substance or items.
frameExamples: The metal was <t>corroded</t> by the water.
This reflects the 15 % jump in <t><fex name='Earnings'>earnings</fex></t> over 1994 .
Native Americans <t>dyed</t> textiles with dyes made from cedar strips.
If this happens one more time, we 're going to <t>switch</t> operating systems.
Our storylines follows the saga outlined by the Ultima Series, but we have <t>modified</t> it in order to make our writing more cohesive.
The players <t>emptied</t> the bucket over his head.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Patient</fen>  is corroded by the <fen>Cause</fen>.
<fen>Cause</fen> identifies an animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>.
The individual that corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cause</fen> corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Cause</fen> corrodes the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Earner</fen> is involved in a transaction or set of transactions as the party that receives payment.
<fen>Earnings</fen> are the money given to the <fen>Earner</fen> in a transaction, generally in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Earner</fen> makes their <fen>Earnings</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Earner</fen> makes their <fen>Earnings</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is a person who applies the Process to the Material.
The <fen>Alterant</fen> causes a change in the <fen>Material</fen>.
The <fen>Material</fen> is altered by the <fen>Agent</fen> in some useful way.
The point in time or period during which the treatment of the <fen>Material</fen> takes place.
The location in which the <fen>Material</fen>s are processed, often a purpose-built facility such as a tannery or water treatment plant.
The individual that changes their situation.
The entities controlled by an Agent to achieve some Purpose.
The tool that the <fen>Agent</fen> had been using.
The tool that the <fen>Agent</fen> ends up using.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> acts intentionally.
This role identifies the place where the <fen>Agent</fen> makes a change.
The sentient entity that effects a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The category of which the <fen>Entity</fen> is a member before the <fen>Agent</fen> causes a change.
The category that the <fen>Entity</fen> belongs to after it has undergone the change.
The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> assumes as a result of the change that the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused to undergo.
The value that the <fen>Attribute</fen> has before the change takes place.
A characteristic of the <fen>Entity</fen> for which a value can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement , or observation.
The abstract or concrete thing or situation that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to change.
An event that causes a change in the <fen>Entity</fen>.
The time at which the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
The location where the change of the <fen>Entity</fen> is caused.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the entity that does the emptying.
The <fen>Theme</fen>, when overtly expressed, invariably occurs in a PP Complement headed by 'of'.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the region or container which is emptied of something.  In this frame, the <fen>Source</fen> occurs as an NP Object.
The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient force which instigates the emptying.
The time at which the emptying takes place.
The location where the emptying takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The metal</fex> was corroded by the water.
<fex>Acid rain</fex> corroded the metal.
Pfizer made billions <fex>in the 1990s</fex> .
She made a lot of money <fex>in Africa</fex> .
Stu treated <fex>the lumber</fex> with magical waterproofing fairydust.
<fex>The system administrator</fex> changed the value from 'KDE' to 'GNOME', and then restarted the system.
Her time with the Healer Craft has changed her <fex>from a shy, nervous young girl</fex> into a confident (almost) young woman
The radical message of the cross transformed Saul of Tarsus and changed him from a persecutor of Christians <fex>to a tender believer</fex>.
We changed the size from 8 1/2x11 <fex>to a larger 11 x 17</fex> and gave it a complete graphical makeover.
My dad changed his hair color <fex>from red</fex>  to blue today.
We changed <fex>the price</fex> from $1.26 to $1.27 per pint.
The recent terrorist attacks had changed <fex>the political climate</fex>.
<fex>Major technological innovations</fex> changed the social and economic conditions.
He changed it <fex>after David Bowie told him that only twerps have the same first and last name</fex>.
<fex>In his own room</fex> he had modified nothing.
<fex>Pat</fex> cleared the table of dishes.
Pat cleared the table <fex>of dishes</fex>.
Pat cleared <fex>the table</fex>.
<fex>A basic washing</fex> can degrease your workclothes.
The prisoners were deloused <fex>in June and August</fex>.
Don't eviscerate him <fex>in the house</fex>!
